intro: Pityrodia canaliculata, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, particularly in coastal or inland regions. It has small, linear leaves and is adapted to thrive in well-drained environments. Pityrodia canaliculata is generally hardy and can tolerate moderate drought conditions.
